title: 2014 Midsummer event

properties.name: description
properties.value: In the 2014 Midsummer event players needed to help Kaqemeex in Taverley that started 26 June 2014. The event consisted of you helping him protect nature from evil corrupting spirits.

content:
2014 Midsummer event
Released 26 June 2014 (Update)
End date 10 July 2014 (Update)
Reward Druidic wreath, Disk of returning, Half full wine jug
Preceded by 2013 Midsummer event
Succeeded by 2015 Midsummer event

In the 2014 Midsummer event players needed to help Kaqemeex in Taverley that started 26 June 2014. The event consisted of you helping him protect nature from evil corrupting spirits.

Contents

  • 1 Walkthrough
  • 2 Post-event: hugging trees
  • 3 Riddles
  • 4 Rewards
  • 5 Trivia

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

The chant is not working.

Speak to Kaqemeex in the druidic circle in Taverley. He will be concerned as the ritual to protect nature from evil spirits isn't working, and the Guthixian altar isn't responding to their chants. He asks you to chant at the Altar of Guthix, but it still isn't working.

After pondering Kaqemeex decides to send you to an old friend of his, Thordur, because he cannot leave the altar. He will teleport you there.

Thordur facepalms.

Once you are in the blackhole, speak to Thordur, who will be frustrated because there was no offering given during the ritual, and that this occurs every year. He asks you to listen to the faint noise, and that it is the riddle to tell the player what is necessary for the ritual to work. Before leaving, Thordur will give you a disk of returning. Use the right-click Activate on the disk on returning to leave the blackhole, you will find yourself in the Dwarven Mines of Falador. Make your way back to Kaqemeex with the answer to the riddle in your inventory, and chant at the altar while it is in your inventory (or use the item on the altar). Kaqemeex will thank you for your efforts and give you a half full wine jug, and that players should repeat the ritual tomorrow, and that doing so three times will earn a special reward.

After each day, players will have to solve a new riddle by speaking to Kaqemeex again, and having him teleport you to Thordur again. Doing so will get another half full wine jug and another disk of returning each day. Players who repeat the ritual three times will receive a druidic wreath.

Post-event: hugging trees[edit | edit source]

A player hugs a tree.

If you wore the druidic wreath (having it in your inventory will not work), you were able to hug any of the four very small trees (smaller than a regular tree) around the Druidic circle (a small tree was located at each of north-west, north-east, south-east, and south-west of the Druidic circle where the 2014 Midsummer event took place). Hugging trees increased a player's tree-hugging rank, and gave players a tree hugging title.

  • 0 hugs - What's a tree?
  • 15 hugs - Tree Cuddler
  • 30 hugs - BARKing Mad
  • 55 hugs - Tree Hugger
  • 75 hugs - At One With Trees

Riddles[edit | edit source]

Date Riddle Answer
7 July A ruiner about magic stone Air rune
6 July To take a charger we hear, mass for protection Steel platebody
5 July Deer and French exploit this ingredient Bucket of milk
4 July Mat wraps around this sticky item Swamp tar
3 July Press the lawyers hard Iron bar
2 July Encourage to be a good one Egg
1 July When mining we hear someone who might want the river police Copper ore
30 June A cow's feet? Leather boots
29 June This valuable is about log grind Gold ring
28 June I hear some cheese before the advert for a staple Bread
27 June This makes you an innocent runecrafter? Rune or pure essence
26 June Falsified the coward, yum! Cooked chicken

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • Disk of returning
  • Half full wine jug
  • Druidic wreath

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The chant is an anagram to the Old School teams Twitter accounts. From left to right: JagexMatK JagexReach JagexJohnC JagexAsh JagexAlfred JagexWeath JagexRonan
  • Logging out after Thordur gives you your disk of returning will return you to the druids circle.
  • During the initial release, players were able to complete the event without the need of a cooked chicken. This was later fixed.
  • If a player is to drop their disk of returning in the black hole their player will start dancing or receive a message saying "well that was disappointing"

In the '''2014 Midsummer event''' players needed to help [[Kaqemeex]] in [[Taverley]] that started [[26 June]] [[2014]]. The event consisted of you helping him protect nature from evil corrupting spirits.
{{ToC}}
{{clear}}

==Walkthrough==
[[File:Kaqemeex chant.png|thumb|left|The chant is not working.]]
Speak to [[Kaqemeex]] in the druidic circle in [[Taverley]]. He will be concerned as the ritual to protect nature from evil spirits isn't working, and the Guthixian altar isn't responding to their chants. He asks you to chant at the Altar of Guthix, but it still isn't working.

After pondering Kaqemeex decides to send you to an old friend of his, [[Thordur]], because he cannot leave the altar. He will teleport you there.
[[File:Thordur facepalm.png|thumb|Thordur facepalms.]]
Once you are in the [[blackhole]], speak to Thordur, who will be frustrated because there was no offering given during the ritual, and that this occurs every year. He asks you to listen to the faint noise, and that it is the riddle to tell the player what is necessary for the ritual to work. Before leaving, Thordur will give you a [[disk of returning]]. Use the right-click Activate on the disk on returning to leave the blackhole, you will find yourself in the Dwarven Mines of Falador. Make your way back to Kaqemeex with the answer to the riddle in your inventory, and chant at the altar while it is in your inventory (or use the item on the altar). Kaqemeex will thank you for your efforts and give you a [[half full wine jug]], and that players should repeat the ritual tomorrow, and that doing so three times will earn a special reward.

After each day, players will have to solve a new riddle by speaking to Kaqemeex again, and having him teleport you to Thordur again. Doing so will get another half full wine jug and another disk of returning each day. Players who repeat the ritual three times will receive a [[druidic wreath]].

==Post-event: hugging trees==
[[File:Hugging tree.gif|frame|A player hugs a tree.]]
If you '''wore''' the druidic wreath (having it in your inventory will not work), you were able to hug any of the four very small trees (smaller than a regular tree) around the Druidic circle (a small tree was located at each of north-west, north-east, south-east, and south-west of the Druidic circle where the 2014 Midsummer event took place). Hugging trees increased a player's tree-hugging rank, and gave players a tree hugging title.

*0 hugs - What's a tree?
*15 hugs - Tree Cuddler
*30 hugs - BARKing Mad
*55 hugs - Tree Hugger
*75 hugs - At One With Trees

==Rewards==
*[[Disk of returning]]
*[[Half full wine jug]]
*[[Druidic wreath]]

==Trivia==
*The chant is an anagram to the Old School teams Twitter accounts. From left to right: JagexMatK JagexReach JagexJohnC JagexAsh JagexAlfred JagexWeath JagexRonan
*Logging out after Thordur gives you your disk of returning will return you to the druids circle.
*During the initial release, players were able to complete the event without the need of a [[cooked chicken]]. This was later fixed.
*If a player is to drop their disk of returning in the black hole their player will start dancing or receive a message saying "well that was disappointing"
